chk 0.0.0.9008
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Benchmarking chk
  • Changelog

Check Object

Source: R/chk.R
chk_true.Rd

Efficiently checks object.

chk_true(x, err = TRUE)

chk_false(x, err = TRUE)

chk_flag(x, err = TRUE)

chk_lgl(x, err = TRUE)

chk_number(x, err = TRUE)

chk_proportion(x, err = TRUE)

chk_whole_number(x, err = TRUE)

chk_count(x, err = TRUE)

chk_string(x, err = TRUE)

chk_date(x, err = TRUE)

chk_datetime(x, err = TRUE)

chk_scalar(x, mode = "any", err = TRUE)

chk_vector(x, mode = "any", err = TRUE)

chk_atomic(x, err = TRUE)

chk_whole_numeric(x, err = TRUE)

chk_grepl(x, pattern = ".+", err = TRUE)

chk_no_missing(x, err = TRUE)

chk_unique(x, err = TRUE)

chk_null(x, err = TRUE)

chk_not_null(x, err = TRUE)

chk_named(x, err = TRUE)

chk_unused(..., err = TRUE)

chk_used(..., err = TRUE)

chk_function(x, err = TRUE)

chk_is(x, class, err = TRUE)

chk_identical(x, y, err = TRUE)

chk_equal(x, y, tolerance = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps), err = TRUE)

chk_equivalent(x, y, tolerance = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps), err = TRUE)

chk_lt(x, value = 0, err = TRUE)

chk_lte(x, value = 0, err = TRUE)

chk_gt(x, value = 0, err = TRUE)

chk_gte(x, value = 0, err = TRUE)

chk_range(x, range = c(0, Inf), err = TRUE)

chk_match(x, values = c(0, Inf), err = TRUE)

chk_dir(x, err = TRUE)

chk_dirs(x, err = TRUE)

chk_file(x, err = TRUE)

chk_files(x, err = TRUE)

Arguments

x

The object to check.
err

A flag specifying whether to generate an error message if the check fails.
mode

A string naming an atomic mode or "list" or "expression" or "any".
pattern

A string of a regular expression.
...

Additional arguments.
class

A string specifying the class.
y

An object to check against.
tolerance

A non-negative numeric scalar.
value

A non-missing scalar of a value.
range

A vector of length 2 of the lower and upper permitted values.
values

A vector of the permitted values.

Value

TRUE if passes check. Otherwise if throws an informative error unless err = FALSE in which case it returns FALSE.

Details

chk_true(): Check TRUE

Checks if TRUE using:

isTRUE(x)

Functions

  • chk_false: Check FALSE

    Checks if FALSE using:

    isFALSE(x)

  • chk_flag: Check Flag

    Checks if non-missing logical scalar using:

    is.logical(x) && length(x) == 1L && !anyNA(x)

  • chk_lgl: Check Lgl

    Checks if logical scalar using:

    is.logical(x) && length(x) == 1L && !anyNA(x)

  • chk_number: Check Number

    Checks if non-mising numeric scalar using:

    is.numeric(x) && length(x) == 1L && !anyNA(x)

  • chk_proportion: Check Proportion

    Checks if non-mising numeric scalar between 0 and 1 using:

    is.numeric(x) && length(x) == 1L && !anyNA(x) && x >= 0 && x <= 1

  • chk_whole_number: Check Whole Number

    Checks if non-mising integer scalar or double equivalent using:

    is.numeric(x) && length(x) == 1L && !anyNA(x) && (is.integer(x) || isTRUE(all.equal(x, as.integer(x))))

  • chk_count: Check Count

    Checks if non-missing non-negative integer scalar or double equivalent using:

    is.numeric(x) && length(x) == 1L && !anyNA(x) && x >= 0 && isTRUE(all.equal(x, as.integer(x)))

  • chk_string: Check String

    Checks if non-missing character scalar using:

    is.character(x) && length(x) == 1L && !anyNA(x)

  • chk_date: Check String

    Checks if non-missing Date scalar using:

    inherits(x, "Date") && length(x) == 1L && !anyNA(x)

  • chk_datetime: Check DateTime

    Checks if non-missing POSIXct scalar using:

    inherits(x, "POSIXct") && length(x) == 1L && !anyNA(x)

  • chk_scalar: Check Scalar

    Checks if scalar using:

    is.vector(x, mode = mode) && length(x) == 1L

    mode should be a string.

  • chk_vector: Check Vector

    Checks if vector using:

    is.vector(x, mode = mode)

    mode should be a string.

  • chk_atomic: Check Atomic

    Checks if atomic using:

    is.atomic(x)

  • chk_whole_numeric: Check Whole Numeric

    Checks if integer vector or double equivalent using the equivalent of:

    is.integer(x) || (is.double(x) && isTRUE(all.equal(x, as.integer(x))))

  • chk_grepl: Check Matches Regular Expression

    Checks if all values match regular expression pattern using:

    all(grepl(pattern, x))

    pattern should be a non-missing character scalar.

  • chk_no_missing: Check No Missing Values

    Checks if no missing values using:

    !anyNA(x)

  • chk_unique: Check Unique

    Checks if unique using:

    !anyDuplicated(x)

  • chk_null: Check NULL

    Checks if NULL using:

    is.null(x)

  • chk_not_null: Check Not NULL

    Checks if not NULL using:

    !is.null(x)

  • chk_named: Check Named

    Checks if is named using:

    !is.null(names(x))

  • chk_unused: Check ... Unused

    Checks if is ... unused using:

    !length(list(...))

  • chk_used: Check ... Used

    Checks if is ... used using:

    length(list(...))

  • chk_function: Check Function

    Checks if is a function using:

    is.function(x)

  • chk_is: Check Is

    Checks if inherits from class using:

    inherits(x, class)

    Class should be a string.

  • chk_identical: Check Identical

    Checks if is identical to y using:

    identical(x, y)

  • chk_equal: Check Equal

    Checks if is equal (identical within tolerance) to y using:

    isTRUE(all.equal(x, y, tolerance))

  • chk_equivalent: Check Equivalent

    Checks if is equivalent (equal ignoring attributes) to y using:

    isTRUE(all.equal(x, y, tolerance, check.attributes = FALSE))

  • chk_lt: Check Less Than

    Checks if all non-missing values are less than value using:

    all(x[!is.na(x)] < value))

    value should be a non-missing scalar.

  • chk_lte: Check Less Than or Equal To

    Checks if all non-missing values are less than or equal to y using:

    all(x[!is.na(x)] <= value))

    value should be a non-missing scalar.

  • chk_gt: Check Greater Than

    Checks if all non-missing values are greater than value using:

    all(x[!is.na(x)] > value))

    value should be a non-missing scalar.

  • chk_gte: Check Greater Than or Equal To

    Checks if all non-missing values are greater than or equal to y using:

    all(x[!is.na(x)] >= value))

    value should be a non-missing scalar.

  • chk_range: Check Range

    Checks if all non-missing values fall within range using:

    all(x[!is.na(x)] >= range[1] & x[!is.na(x)] <= range[2])

    Range should be a non-mising sorted vector of length 2.

  • chk_match: Check Match

    Checks if all values match values using equivalent of:

    all(match(x, values, nomatch = 0) > 0)

  • chk_dir: Check Directory Exists

    Checks if directory exist using:

    length(x) == 1L && dir.exists(x))

  • chk_dirs: Check Directories Exist

    Checks if directories exist using:

    all(dir.exists(x))

  • chk_file: Check File Exists

    Checks if file exists using:

    length(x) == 1L & file.exists(x) && !dir.exists(x)

  • chk_files: Check Files Exist

    Checks if files exist using:

    all(file.exists(x) && !dir.exists(x))

Examples


# chk_true
chk_true(1, err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
chk_true(NA, err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
chk_true(FALSE, err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
chk_true(TRUE)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_true(c(TRUE, TRUE), err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE

# chk_false
chk_false(0, err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
chk_false(NA, err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
chk_false(TRUE, err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
chk_false(FALSE)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_false(c(FALSE, FALSE), err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE


# chk_flag
chk_flag(1, err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
chk_flag(NA, err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
chk_flag(TRUE)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_flag(FALSE)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_flag(c(TRUE, TRUE), err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE


# chk_lgl
chk_lgl(1, err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
chk_lgl(NA)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_lgl(TRUE)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_lgl(FALSE)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_lgl(c(TRUE, TRUE), err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE


# chk_unique
chk_unique(NA)
#> [1] TRUE
chk_unique(c(NA, NA), err = FALSE)
#> [1] FALSE
